bill_title: provide for administrative assistants to the offices of majority and minority leadership and to make an appropriation therefor.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for administrative assistants to the offices of majority and minority leadership and to make an appropriation therefor. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 2-9 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The Legislative Research Council shall provide for the full-time employment of three persons as administrative assistants to the majority and minority offices. Two shall be allotted to the majority party and one shall be allotted to the minority party. The majority party, for the purposes of this Act, is the party with the largest number of members elected to the Legislature. The minority party is the party with the second largest number of members elected to the Legislature. Section 2. That chapter 2-9 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The Executive Board of the Legislative Research Council shall administer the provisions of this Act and shall provide such funding, office space, utilities, and technical support as is deemed appropriate. Such funding and services shall be allotted on a pro rata basis of two to one between the majority and minority parties. Section 3. That chapter 2-9 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The selection and supervision of the administrative assistants shall be by the respective party caucuses under such restrictions as the Executive Board may impose. Such restrictions shall be adopted by the Executive Board prior to each legislative session and may not be amended during any legislative session except a unanimous vote of the board membership. Section 4. That chapter 2-9 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: No person may be an administrative assistant who is not at least twenty-one years of age, a resident of South Dakota, and a graduate of an accredited college or university. No person may be an administrative assistant who is the spouse, sibling, child, or grandchild of a legislator. No person may be an administrative assistant who is otherwise employed by any legislator or political party. Section 5. There is hereby appropriated from the general fund the sum of one hundred fifty thousand dollars ($150,000), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Legislative Research Council to implement the provisions of this Act. Section 6. The director of the Legislative Research Council shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. Section 7. Any amounts appropriated in this Act not lawfully expended or obligated by June 30, 2002, shall revert in accordance with § 4-8-21.
